greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) = k*(k-n-1)*(k-n-2)/2 read by rows, 1<=k<=n.
comment: The triangle can be constructed multiplying the triangle A(n,k)=n-k+1 (if 1<=k<=n, else 0) by the triangle B(n,k) =k (if 1<=k<=n, else 0).
Swapping the two triangles of this matrix product would generate A104634.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n=1..100 of triangle, flattened
example: First few rows of the triangle:
mathematica: Table[k*(k-n-1)*(k-n-2)/2, {n, 1, 20}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 12 2018 *)
program: (PARI) for(n=1,20, for(k=1,n, print1(k*(k-n-1)*(k-n-2)/2, ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 12 2018
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Mar 18 2005
